snippet: African-American women may process azithromycin at the same rate in pregnancy that they do otherwise, but that women of other races tend to metabolize the drug more slowly.
abstract: James H Fischer study in journal Antimicrobial Agents and Chemotherapy suggests that the correct dose of antibiotics in pregnancy may be different for African-Americans than for other women.
lead_paragraph: African-American women may process azithromycin at the same rate in pregnancy that they do otherwise, but that women of other races tend to metabolize the drug more slowly.

headline.seo: Antibiotic Dosage May Vary for Pregnant Women
headline.main: Regimens: Antibiotic Dosage May Vary in Pregnancy
headline.print_headline: Regimens: Antibiotic Dosage May Vary in Pregnancy
